FSPMI Tolak Besaran UMP Kalsel 2020
04 Nov 2019, 10:50 by Dicky Munadi


FSPMI Tolak Besaran UMP Kalsel 2020

KBRN Banjarmasin : Pengambilan keputusan UMP Tahun 2020 yang ditetapkan Pemprov Kalsel  melalui SK Gubernur Kalsel, per 1 Januari mendatang sebesar 2,8 juta rupiah sangat disayangkan sejumlah serikat buruh.
Ketua Federasi Serikat Pekerja Metal Indonesia (FSPMI) Kalimantan Selatan, Yuyun Indharto, tegaskan menolak besaran UMP 2020 karena dinilai mengabaikan komponen hidup layak (KHL) buruh.
"Gubernur Sahbirin Noor mesti mempertimbangkan masukan dari pekerja, sebelum ujug-ujug menetapkan UMP 2020," katanya.
Menurut Yuyun, acuan upah minimum berdasarkan kebutuhan hidup layak sejatinya sudah diatur dalam UU Ketenagakerjaan.
"Ini sudah tidak sesuai. Makanya kami konsisten menolak," ujarnya. 
Untuk menyuarakkan hal ini, pihak FSPMI sedang merencanakan aksi besar untuk menolak UMP 2020 di Kalsel. Demonstrasi bakal digelar dalam kurun waktu satu sampai dua pekan mendatang.
"Sesuai perhitungan pemerintah kan naiknya 8,51 persen, Kalau mengacu KHL bisa sampai 10-15 persen ini yang akan kami suarakkan," pungkasnya.

FSPMI Refuses Amount of UMP South Kalimantan 2020
04 Nov 2019, 10:50 by Dicky Munadi


FSPMI Refuses Amount of UMP South Kalimantan 2020

KBRN Banjarmasin: The 2020 UMP decision-making set by the South Kalimantan Provincial Government through the South Kalimantan Governor's Decree, as of January 1, amounting to 2.8 million rupiah, is unfortunate for a number of labor unions.
The Chairman of the Federation of Indonesian Metal Workers Union (FSPMI) of South Kalimantan, Yuyun Indharto, firmly rejected the 2020 UMP amount because it was considered to neglect the component of decent living (KHL) for workers.
"Governor Sahbirin Noor must consider input from workers before setting a 2020 UMP," he said.
According to Yuyun, the minimum wage reference based on the necessities of decent living is actually regulated in the Manpower Act.
"This is not appropriate. So we consistently refuse," he said.
To articulate this, FSPMI is planning a major action to reject the 2020 UMP in South Kalimantan. Demonstrations will be held within the next one to two weeks.
"According to the government's calculation, the increase is 8.51 percent. If we refer to KHL, we can raise 10-15 percent," he concluded.
